Super dorky, but clean
A fairly generic script with lots of disposable bad guys.
Yet another "cool violence" mess. If you're looking for something with a script written by an adult, pass this up.
This movie has some violence, but it's written really well and the most likable characters are vindicated by the script.
A concentration on horrible mentalities being medicated by horrible things. A broken film about broken people. Also just dull and slow.
This is a great one-time watch as anything with Jackie Chan is.
in progress
This is a pretty decent small town crime movie. It seems made for TV - but still pretty good.
Remains a classic story that everyone should watch.
A concept stolen from the Bible and turned into a low-budget "superhero" movie. Just to be clear, it's not good.

data.movie: Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
data.comment: They should have just stopped with the original.
Interesting but violent and the plot could have been teased out a bit more smoothly.
Runs ok for 10 minutes, then turns into the most generic B-movie about sharks. From there on it gets progressively worse until the only option you have left is to cringe heavily.
Builds slowly but hits hard. Too close to home.
Just another drug movie. You get what you'd expect. For me it's insufferably dull.
Forgettable
A TV movie that seems like it's from the 90's. Don't look for good acting, a decent script, or a quality soundtrack.
Just when you think the action is going to really start, the movie ends. Okay for Stargate faithfuls - but not a terrific film.
Pretty good western even if it felt rushed toward the end.
Too much story to comfortably follow. It starts interestingly enough but fades into a whodunit that isn't especially entertaining.

data.movie: As Far as the Eye Can See
data.comment: Not a bad movie, but very slow.
It was a treat to see young Dreyfuss and to see another angle of music appreciation.
Speaks volumes about the ineffectiveness of law to provide true justice. Only God can do that.
Weird demonization of religion again, but appeared as if it would be a good movie. Tubi removed it mid-movie so I didn't get to finish it.
Another testament to what happens when people are not obedient to God. A film that wanders.

data.movie: Samuel: The Last of the Judges
data.comment: Feels like a TV special - dubbed and very B movie-ish
This was entertaining but man, the dude was so unprepared/prepared and a horrible fighter against a tiny woman.
This was a bit strange. Interesting to see young Cage and Modine. The bird thing was... odd. The ending bumps it up a smidge though.

data.movie: Day The Earth Stood Still, The
data.comment: Decent remake of the original with updated effects.
Dryly Funny and tells great stories on two fronts. (subtitled)
Everything that you expect occurs in this movie - but that it was based on a true story makes it great.

data.movie: Ash Lad: In Search of the Golden Castle, The
data.comment: This is a terrific pair of movies with cinematography that makes me also want to see a more serious film from this director. Very well done and clean as a bonus.
I'm always partial to Jodie Foster, but this one is a great thriller. The person who did the transitions for credits/scenes also needs an award. Well done.
This kind of movie will always appeal to a good person's sense of vengeance. It doesn't make it right - but it sure is satisfying.
A movie which tries to suggest that God is an alien. Entertaining, but philosophically flawed.
Another disposable "crime is cool" movie. Not my tempo. Did not finish it.
A forgettable "crime and how bad it is" movie.
Crime movies seem to be popular these days. This one is no surprise but interesting to have been based off of a true story.
Quickly becoming one of my favorite directors - even if this one is predictable and follows common "main character always wins" conventions

For a baseball fan, this is  one you won't have missed. Sports hold a special place for many of us. Some camera work which is ahead of its time too. For Gehrig, it must have been a wonderful life. 2,131 games.
A darker ending than I think was appropriate for the style of movie before it. But still well constructed. The soundtrack is also well done.
Another show that mysteriously vilifies Christianity as if it has anything to do with aliens. Otherwise well constructed, but dark and a bit dull.
A good one-time movie night watch. Nothing is stand-out amazing about it. One of a long line of idiot-henchmen type movies.
Intriguing the first time, but it vanished quickly from memory. So it must not have been stellar.
Having any experience with autism will make you really appreciate this movie. Fairly well done - even if the "genius" part got overplayed.
This is another movie that I remember having watched - but also remember nothing about. It's a standard heist movie. It has been done before. It will be done again.
Two movies mashed into one. Unfortunately, the one intriguing character (John Rain) isn't featured with enough action. Script is very generic.
A great Will Smith style action movie. Not a fan of the blasphemy and cursing (unnecessary). But otherwise a great film.

data.movie: Old Man and the Sea, The
data.comment: A great clean story that will be difficult to find in the future.
Directed beautifully. One of those movies that will mean a ton to some and nothing for others. Speaks volumes about the struggles of a man.
Not a great film. Stale acting and weird moments of "lesson teaching" that were silly. Okay to watch once but will fade quickly in film history.

Lacks a professional touch. Definitely a B-movie. But the subject matter is of utmost importance. Evidence of the Bible's truth can be found in the lack of high quality products supporting the greatest stories ever told.
More of a story-driven Western than many I've seen. My first time seeing Jack Nicholson in a Western. He also wrote it.
Some great action that is slowed down by a character who instantly falls in love with her bodyguard/bird. The tech is very cool. The "Twilight" aspect is not so much. Several eye-rolling moments.
Jaime Foxx is funny. Doug Hutchison plays a good villain. Mike Epps is also funny as usual. Good 2000's era movie. It's a shame they can't make this kind of movie cleanly though.

Costner insists on blasphemy and a strange mockery of Bethlehem. The main character also takes a frustratingly long time to become the hero viewers suspect he will become. These two things drag down an otherwise terrific movie.

Great seeing Warren Oates in his prime. A strange psycho woman joins a psycho Nicholson on a hunt which mostly is shown by long drawn-out riding scenes. The ending is confusing, unexpected, and is a bit of a letdown.
Heartbreaking and also strange. The main characters don't seem to be only grief-stricken. They are also slightly psychotic. Grief is portrayed well, though I question some of the ways it is shown.
I'm not a fan of hyper-symbolic, surreal movies. It would be unfair of me to attempt to rate this. 20 minutes in, I found myself checking to see if it was halfway over yet.
Not a terrific movie by any stretch. Very 80's. Very generic script.

Marlon delivers his traditional icy-faced lines. Lots of future stars hiding in this film too. The movie could have done with a few more deleted scenes to shorten it up but it has a pretty good ending.
Much more violent than I remembered - but some classic memorable action movie moments.
Robocop gets far too beat up in this one. But still, he manages to pull off a couple of cool moves. The stop-motion robots were a little distracting. Overall not as good as the first movie.
Ed Harris, especially, shows his acting chops in a big way. This film shows the powerful effects of war without leaning on war scenes too heavily.
Giovanni Ribisi is great as usual. It's entertaining but also dark. Another display of crime not being profitable.
Even with dubbed voices, this was pretty good. And I had never heard of the battle at Rzhev before.
This movie is just well done all the way around. The story is beautiful. The direction and the music are great. The actors nailed the roles. Just plain excellent.
Fairly typical movie of this type. It's good but will not climb any charts.

Grown men and women acting like teenagers. There's an obvious and extended mockery of religion in general and a glamorization of the normal worldly ways. Skip this one. Especially if you are looking for a real film.
Glorifies sex and "getting high". A sad, ignorant , and juvenile view of a love story. I tried to watch it but didn't find it worth finishing. (I survived 20 minutes or so)
Pretty standard script with the generic father/daughter bonding undercurrent. Pretty well put together. The energetic soundtrack keeps things rolling.
A bit of a chilling documentary to see video of a man now exiled in real life. Who is reading this?
Sad and chilling record of a man who died trying to do something good for someone else - and the team who worked with him.
Charming movie of clashing cultures and real American dreams. It is a refreshing standout as a PG movie among "MA" movies.
Though there were some scenes that were definitely not necessary, this is overall a compelling movie which depicts vigilante justice for the most pernicious and evil of men.
Interesting look at the mentality and somewhat obscure (to most people) world of climbing tall mountains.
Deeply sad and depressing look at how lives can be forever altered by one small moment.
Sad look at how greed can override moral integrity
This one is a terrific western. Another story of vengeance. I was not a fan of the opening scenes which led to the vengeance, but it was kept clean enough to get the point across.
Cusack plays a very stale man with an evil job, who gets evil-ed at. I don't know what else to say about it.
Pretty good play of a very simple script. The voice-acting was well done. (Norwegian film)
A movie which does everything it can to paint religion as evil. Strange. Sick. Aptly named.
A violent and sad movie. I'm not sure why you would make a film like this.
Compared to other movies, this one is refreshingly clean. Unfortunately, there is a subtle pretentious element that seems to override the better message of the Gospel of Jesus Christ.
There are good elements to this and it is overall an interesting enough story. Still, it felt very Hollywood.
DNF - There is a scene in this movie that is so reprehensible that I will never finish this. Irresponsible filmmaking.
The title is a bit misleading - because of modern movies with similar names. A great look at a time that will never exist again.
Nothing really groundbreaking here story-wise. But everything is done professionally and the food looks amazing.
Short. Kinda choppy. Some redeeming qualities, but overall falls flat.

Right off the bat we have a generic script where Costner plays a savior-figure so dedicated to his work that his wife wants to leave him. But by the end of the movie, you find that you were wrapt completely. Fairly well done overall. It's a bit of a shame that it's so predictable that the impactful moments are less impactful.
Watching this was stressful because of the absolutely terrible decisions each character made. More ugly violence.

data.movie: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid
data.comment: The way Newman and Redford play the roles is something special. This one is a forever classic.
dnf - more like a documentary
Putting yourself in the shoes of someone from the 60's, this is a very good anti-racism movie. Lots of biblical themes even if the main character is a bit flippant about them.
For a secular music movie, it's pretty good. It's sad that such a love of music is sought after such that it's the music that becomes someone's "savior".
There is a very subtle B-movie feel that emerges a short way in. Still, this is an interesting story that won't let you down on entertainment.
The fight scenes are choreographed pretty well, but the movie overall was corny and cliché.
This movie is... indescribably good. It hits home on a personal level.
This will be especially impactful for Christians. It is a low-budget film, but that hardly matters. The message is just too good to allow that to stop you from enjoying it.
Few films these days will be as special  as this. Kendrick gives Christians a story that is almost sure to bring tears of joy.

Clearly the production quality has increased for the Kendrick brothers by the time this movie was released. Still, the stories are a bit better in some of the others. Terrific acting throughout and the grandmother character is especially charming.
A strong step up in the quality of Christian movies. This one is a great watch for fathers across the world.

Easily the worst copycat of this story. The script holds more atheism than Bible and doesn't even attempt to discuss God in any meaningful way. Also, the characters - just about all of them - react unrealistically and wander about aimlessly in contrived "panic". Not a good film.
Corny, but still a bit of an upgrade from the older Bible shows

Fairly well done. A bit basic in all areas and not groundbreaking. But it's a clean movie with a decent enough plot and some spice of basic Bible themes. Marked improvement for the genre of "faith films". Yet something about it felt a little stale.
A bit teenage-adventure-ish, but the deep voice of the narration keeps it grounded enough to be pretty good in the end. No violence, or swearing, or other unnecessary scenes. Well done overall.
A bit stale and doesn't particularly follow the Bible account too closely. Other characters are introduced that aren't really part of the story. Overall, just kinda odd.
Not bad, especially for the '90s. A good reminder of some of the lesser known characters in the Bible surrounding Solomon.
This movie starts out with a very professional feel and is well done. Then it continues. I've never cringed so much in my life.
Great classic movie that doesn't feel much like Christmas. But it's clean and funny. Well done.
It doesn't get much worse. One of the most predictable scripts of all time. At least it's clean though.
Very sad but very romantic. A film that tests whether or not you have a heart.
Pretty standard action movie tropes throughout - but also excessively violent. It's a one-time-watch movie for me.
Kinda drags a bit and is clearly a low budget movie. Interesting enough to get through once, but not particularly mind-blowing.
Dorky, but an okay early December watch to prepare for Christmas.
Dorky, but an okay early December watch to prepare for Christmas... 2.
Doesn't quite have the visceral feel of other films in this genre. It feels a bit too soft. Also, the female empowerment scenes are getting very old in movies like this.
Definitely has its moments. Eddie is funny as always. No landmark of film, but a clean movie for the whole family.
It will keep you watching, but also a grim reminder of just how broken this world is.
Started off okay, but got progressively worse. Like many modern spoofs, the potential for humor is ruined by crass, stupid, overly sexual, violent, or otherwise crude content.
The potential for quality is ruined by crass, stupid, overly sexual, violent, or otherwise crude content. Basic script, ridiculous villains. Not great.
Like Indiana Jones for horseback riders. There is a slight flavor of Hollywood cowboy instead of real cowboy. But it's clean, adventurous, and has a great story behind it.
Low budget. Had a great ending, but took a bit too long to get to it.
Starts out great, but Danny Kaye's voices and facial expressions were overplayed. Like watching cartoons in real life. Definitely has great moments.

Redford is awesome as usual. Almost zero lines, but hardly any needed anyway. My kind of movie. Loved it. Just a tiny bit too much looking around instead of showing action - otherwise I would place this much higher on my list.
Great movie to close out the 80s. It's a little unfortunate that they ruined it by adding so much blasphemy and swearing. It would have been a terrific family movie otherwise.
Although this movie has been done over and over, Zemeckis adds a beautiful flow to the story that is punctuated by terrific animation and storytelling. It's a wonderful update to a classic.
Fast-talking Vaughn is always hilarious to me. This doesn't quite make the list of greats, but is still a good one to add to the list for Christmastime.

This one will have major nostalgic value for the right age group. And for them, I don't have to describe it to you. It doesn't quite have that same connection for me - but still a clean family cartoon. For that, I love it.
A good continuation of the previously released classic. Clean and decent for the whole family. For those who love Christmas, this one makes the list for those with kids.

To make this live-action is a huge endeavor. Howard does so in the best way possible. The entire movie feels exactly the way it should, is led by a very funny Jim Carrey, along with a full cast of greats. Among the top of the list for the Christmas season.
